stateStandardName: Ohio`s Learning Standards and Model Curriculum

objectives.objectiveDescription: Students will understand the sun as the primary source of energy

expectations.expectationDescription: Students will explain that sunlight warms Earth's land, air, and water.
Students will identify that the amount of sunlight exposure affects the warming or cooling of air, water, and land.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Students will explore the different forms of water on Earth

expectations.expectationDescription: Students will describe that water on Earth exists in many forms.

Students will explain that the physical properties of water can change due to changes in energy. They will identify that water can change from a liquid to a solid (freezing) and from a solid to a liquid (melting).

objectives.objectiveDescription: Students will investigate how properties of objects and materials can change

expectations.expectationDescription: Students will observe that objects and materials change when exposed to various conditions, such as heating or cooling. They will understand that changes in temperature are a result of changes in energy.
Students will identify that not all materials change in the same way when exposed to different conditions.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Students will explore motion and how objects can be moved

expectations.expectationDescription: Students will describe the position of an object by locating it relative to another object or its surroundings.
Students will identify that an object is in motion when its position changes.

Students will explain that the motion of an object can be affected by pushing or pulling (forces). They will understand that a push or pull can make an object move faster, slower, or change direction.
Students will recognize that changes in motion are a result of changes in energy.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Students will understand the basic needs of living things

expectations.expectationDescription: Students will identify that living things require energy, water, and a specific temperature range in their environment.
Students will explain that plants get energy from sunlight, while animals get energy from plants and other animals.
Students will recognize that living things acquire resources from both living and nonliving components of their environment.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Students will explore how living things survive in their environment

expectations.expectationDescription: Students will understand that resources are necessary to meet the needs of individual organisms and populations.
Students will explain how living things interact with their physical environments to meet their needs.
